intro: Euphlebium coeloglossum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed water-plantain, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that are typically submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on long, slender pedicels. It thrives in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. Euphlebium coeloglossum plays an important ecological role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and amphibians.
